title: Hewlet
author: Hewlet
content: My countryÂ  people, I trowe salute give una o! You know, one bad thing I know too like about us as Nigerians na say we too de adapt to things too easily. Like, the intensity of sun for the country don really de worry like this on a serious note and we seem not to be bothered about it.Even though now na raining season, any day when sun wan burst out like this, e no de easy at all. The worst part is that our government and private sectors are doing absolutely nothing feasible to reduce the rate at which the activities of companies flaring gases and the cars putting out poisonous smoke in the surroundings can be curbed.People are not even being sensitized that much in society regarding the importance of planting trees in our surroundings and even d trees that are already planted have startedÂ  being cut down lately.I fear for the future of our country because the whole issue about climate change is being taken for granted and it appears as though we are just concerned about the presence at the detriment of the disaster that awaits us in the future.

comments.author: Bitco55
comments.body: Op, Â E for beta if you been research this topic very well before you con write on am.First of all, isn't the ability of fast adaption a very good thing? If that's how we are, shouldn't we be thankful for our strong resilience and strength?Â Secondly, concerning climate, haven't you heard of the different kinds of climate around the world?The reason ours is too hot isn't cause of government or private sector activities. Although that has a role to play, the reason is that we're located very close to the equator where the sun hits more than other regions and therefore we feel the heat from the sun more.Â  Â  Think about it, our industrialization isn't even up to half of what you'd find in some other countries, but there are still seasons where snow falls regularly. So, the depletion of the ozone layer is worldwide, not just in our country.And again, don't blame the government, we even need more industries and privately owned production enterprises in this country.

comments.body: The truth be say too much sun dey cause a lot of health issues like sunburn, heat stroke, dehydration, hyponatremia, heat exhaustion amongst many and apart from climate changes wey fit play a role in this mata, I also feel say we no dey protected from this punishment unto say most of our trees don dey cut down to build industries wey release harmful substances into the atmosphere and further adding more fuel to the fire. E no gud but if you ask me, e beta pass wen nah too much rain we dey experience as that go cause erosion and this go pose wahala to our crops which go in turn cause food to dey costly. Â Too much rain go cause flood and that no be something umbrella or cap fit solve. comments.author: Richbased
comments.body: Quote from: Hewlet on September 25, 2023, 12:54:12 PMMy countryÂ  people, I trowe salute give una o! The worst part is that our government and private sectors are doing absolutely nothing feasible to reduce the rate at which the activities of companies flaring gases and the cars putting out poisonous smoke in the surroundings can be curbed.People are not even being sensitized that much in society regarding the importance of planting trees in our surroundings and even d trees that are already planted have startedÂ  being cut down lately.I fear for the future of our country because the whole issue about climate change is being taken for granted and it appears as though we are just concerned about the presence at the detriment of the disaster that awaits us in the future.Despite the fact that Nigeria is close to the equator thereby making it possible for the sun to fall directly on us I still see that the incessant industrial activities in the country like the gas flaring industry have really dissolve the Ozone layers thereby making the sun to still heat directly on us and the worst part of it is that this flaring industries normally give allocation for individuals to be treated but a set of top leaders succumb this funds to their personal pockets rather than making it available to the public.The sun have really affected us so much over the years by causing eye problems and even making the roof of our houses to rust earlier than it would have ought to be. Since there is no way these industrial activities can be stopped considering the fact that gas flaring has aided us so much in boosting the economy of the country and even if it is being stopped the deed has already been done so I suggest that the allocation that is being given to the various communities should be checked by the various industries to know if they're being shared equally to the individuals. And I also suggest that the industries should also make provision for an eye check to check the visibility of the individuals and possible treatment if there is an eye defect.

comments.body: Quote from: Mr.right85 on November 13, 2023, 07:46:59 PMOmo, I really feel say this our local board for Dey segmented into sub boards so that, we for feet dey fit certain things into places way be say, e no go tire person to discern why the post or why them post am for where them post am.Climate change na very sensitive discussion but, e go hard for you to tell person way no believe in science say, na this thing dey worry am or na even issue at all.Something way I no understands with OP be say, you really expect people lot to adapt to changes in there environment?No forget say the laws of adoption is either you adapt or die out o.While the preaching remains that mitigations and abstaining from fossil fuel should be practiced, we still be a raw material country, our consciousness Dey very low.Â  The steady sun wey we dey face for the country na as a result of some factors wey generally fall under the climate change action and reactions. For the country now, we dey celebrate cool weather because we sabi wetin we dey face when sun come out. It is the extra stress it adds to the day plus the tiredness it gives afterwards, the drained ness, the dehydrated level it places us. At that point we don't know the solution to give, all we'd ever need will be a cool soothing weather or water so our temperature at that time would be balanced.Â  Â Excess heat on a norms isn't good for the body but here in Nigeria we take it in on a daily basis, from excess fossil fuels burning and combustion, it accumulates in the environment and joins with the already heated temperature and then still hits back at us. There just should be proper means created for burning this fuel as it'll help regulate the temperature to some extent. We're suffering enough, we really do not need any extra suffering added.
